definition: stir-fried pork, favorite of Northern Song writer Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼, a.k.a. Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: To be more precise, I’m gonna talk about the intercity express train, the west lake and the soysauced Dongpo Pork.
sentences.chinese: 具體來說，我想談談城際特快列車，西湖和東坡肉。

sentences.english: I like West Lake Fish in Sweet Sour Source and Dongpo Pork.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡西湖醋魚和東坡肉。

sentences.english: Dongpo Pork is quite good in color, smell and taste and is favored greatly by people.
sentences.chinese: 東坡肉在色澤，香氣和口味上都很好，因而廣受歡迎。

sentences.english: B: I like West Lake Fish in Sweet Sour Source and Dongpo Pork.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡西湖醋魚和東坡肉。

sentences.english: Dongpo Pork is a famous Chinese dish that prevails in Jiangsu and Zhejiang Provinces.
sentences.chinese: 東坡肉是一道盛行於江浙一帶並且很有名氣的中國菜。

sentences.english: The third was dong-po-rou (Dongpo Pork), which must be eaten when you travel in Hangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 這第三樣就是到杭州必喫的“東坡肉”。

definition: lit. Buddha jumps over the wall, name for a Chinese dish that uses many non-vegetarian ingredients
chicken in rice wine/also translated drunken chicken
Cantonese poached chicken, known as "white cut chicken"
fish maw/a food dish made from the swim bladder of fish
variant of 滷味|卤味[lu3 wei4]

yuxiang, a seasoning of Chinese cuisine that typically contains garlic, scallions, ginger, sugar, salt, chili peppers etc (Although "yuxiang" literally means "fish fragrance", it contains no seafood.)
Cantonese poached chicken, known as "white cut chicken"
